section_title: WORK PROGRAMME TO FURTHER THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE DIVERSITY OF NAMAs
sentences: This item (FCCC/SBI/2014/INF.1 and 10) was introduced in plenary on 4 June.
SBI Chair reported the first successful 'match' between a NAMA from Georgia and support from Austria.
Informal consultations were co-facilitated by Ann Gann (Singapore) and Dimitar Nikov (France).

During informal consultations, parties addressed, inter alia , reporting by the Secretariat on the NAMA registry, and the report of the work programme to further the understanding of the diversity of NAMAs for COP 20.
